11#ifndef VIDEO_VIDEO_SOURCE_SINK_CONTROLLER_H_
12#define VIDEO_VIDEO_SOURCE_SINK_CONTROLLER_H_
13
14#include <string>
15#include <vector>
16
17#include "absl/types/optional.h"
18#include "api/sequence_checker.h"
19#include "api/video/video_frame.h"
20#include "api/video/video_sink_interface.h"
21#include "api/video/video_source_interface.h"
22#include "call/adaptation/video_source_restrictions.h"
23#include "rtc_base/system/no_unique_address.h"
24
25namespace webrtc {
26
27// Responsible for configuring source/sink settings, i.e. performing
28// rtc::VideoSourceInterface<VideoFrame>::AddOrUpdateSink(). It does this by
29// storing settings internally which are converted to rtc::VideoSinkWants when
30// PushSourceSinkSettings() is performed.
31class VideoSourceSinkController {
32 public:
33 VideoSourceSinkController(rtc::VideoSinkInterface<VideoFrame>* sink,
34 rtc::VideoSourceInterface<VideoFrame>* source);
35
36 ~VideoSourceSinkController();
37
38 void SetSource(rtc::VideoSourceInterface<VideoFrame>* source);
39 bool HasSource() const;
40
41 // Must be called in order for changes to settings to have an effect. This
42 // allows you to modify multiple properties in a single push to the sink.
43 void PushSourceSinkSettings();
44
45 VideoSourceRestrictions restrictions() const;
46 absl::optional<size_t> pixels_per_frame_upper_limit() const;
47 absl::optional<double> frame_rate_upper_limit() const;
48 bool rotation_applied() const;
49 int resolution_alignment() const;
50 const std::vector<rtc::VideoSinkWants::FrameSize>& resolutions() const;
51
52 // Updates the settings stored internally. In order for these settings to be
53 // applied to the sink, PushSourceSinkSettings() must subsequently be called.
54 void SetRestrictions(VideoSourceRestrictions restrictions);
55 void SetPixelsPerFrameUpperLimit(
56 absl::optional<size_t> pixels_per_frame_upper_limit);
57 void SetFrameRateUpperLimit(absl::optional<double> frame_rate_upper_limit);
58 void SetRotationApplied(bool rotation_applied);
59 void SetResolutionAlignment(int resolution_alignment);
60 void SetResolutions(std::vector<rtc::VideoSinkWants::FrameSize> resolutions);
61
62 private:
63 rtc::VideoSinkWants CurrentSettingsToSinkWants() const
64 RTC_EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(sequence_checker_);
65
66 // Used to ensure that this class is called on threads/sequences that it and
67 // downstream implementations were designed for.
68 // In practice, this represent's libjingle's worker thread.
69 RTC_NO_UNIQUE_ADDRESS SequenceChecker sequence_checker_;
70
71 rtc::VideoSinkInterface<VideoFrame>* const sink_;
72 rtc::VideoSourceInterface<VideoFrame>* source_
73 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
74 // Pixel and frame rate restrictions.
75 VideoSourceRestrictions restrictions_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
76 // Ensures that even if we are not restricted, the sink is never configured
77 // above this limit. Example: We are not CPU limited (no |restrictions_|) but
78 // our encoder is capped at 30 fps (= |frame_rate_upper_limit_|).
79 absl::optional<size_t> pixels_per_frame_upper_limit_
80 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
81 absl::optional<double> frame_rate_upper_limit_
82 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
83 bool rotation_applied_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_) = false;
84 int resolution_alignment_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_) = 1;
85 std::vector<rtc::VideoSinkWants::FrameSize> resolutions_
86 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
87};
88
89} // namespace webrtc
90
91#endif // VIDEO_VIDEO_SOURCE_SINK_CONTROLLER_H_
92
